# Welcome to `cheatsheetr`!

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of `cheatsheetr` is to provide R exercises from RStudio's excellent cheatsheets. 

## Installation

You can install the development version of `cheatsheetr` like so:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("mjfrigaard/cheatsheetr")
```

## Example

This is a basic example:

```{r example, eval=FALSE}
library(cheatsheetr)
library(learnr)
## basic example code
learnr::run_tutorial("import", package = "cheatsheetr")
```

# Cheatsheet tutorials

Below are the tutorials based on the cheatsheet contents. 

## Import

These exercises cover the **Data import with `readr`, `readxl`, and `googlesheets4` cheatsheet** cheatsheet. Download it [here](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/main/data-import.pdf).

```{r import-side-by-side.png, echo=FALSE, out.height='100%', out.width='100%'}
knitr::include_graphics(path = "man/figures/import-side-by-side.png")
```


```{r run-import-local, eval=FALSE}
## run local
learnr::run_tutorial("import", package = "cheatsheetr")
```

[Click here](https://mjfrigaard.shinyapps.io/import/)  to run in your browser.

## Tidy

The **Data tidying with `tidyr` cheatsheet** is broken into two parts. Read more about the [`tidyr` package](https://tidyr.tidyverse.org/), which is designed to *help you create tidy data.* Download the cheatsheet [here](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/main/tidyr.pdf).

### Part 1


```{r 2tidyr-p1, echo=FALSE, fig.align='center', out.height='100%', out.width='100%'}

```

```{r run-tidyr-p1-local, eval=FALSE}
## run local

```

[Click here](https://mjfrigaard.shinyapps.io/tidyr-p1/)  to run in your browser.

# Extra tutorials

Below are additional topics not covered in the RStudio cheatsheets:

## Command-line intro

These exercises don't come from a cheatsheet, but they do cover some common command-line tools worth knowing. 

```{r run-commandline-local, eval=FALSE}
## run local
learnr::run_tutorial("commandline", package = "cheatsheetr")
```

[Click here](https://mjfrigaard.shinyapps.io/command-line/) to run in your browser. 

## Atomic vectors 

This provides a brief introduction to R's most common object: the vector. 

```{r run-atomic-vectors-local, eval=FALSE}
## run local
learnr::run_tutorial("atomic-vectors", package = "cheatsheetr")
```

[Click here](https://mjfrigaard.shinyapps.io/atomic-vectors/) to run in your browser.

## S3 vectors 

This introduces more complex vectors (factors, dates, date-times and difftimes).

```{r run-S3-vectors-local, eval=FALSE}
## run local
learnr::run_tutorial("S3-vectors", package = "cheatsheetr")
```

[Click here](https://mjfrigaard.shinyapps.io/S3-vectors/) to run in your browser.

## `data.frame`s

An introduction to rectangular (spreadsheet) data in R. 

```{r run-data.frames-local, eval=FALSE}
## run local
learnr::run_tutorial("dataframes", package = "cheatsheetr")
```

[Click here](https://mjfrigaard.shinyapps.io/dataframes/) to run in your browser.
